# Morocco Art Guide
> Comprehensive guide to Moroccan visual art — artists, movements, galleries, and institutions.

## About
Morocco Art Guide documents Moroccan painters, sculptors, photographers, and multimedia artists from the Casablanca School (1960s) to contemporary. It maps museums, galleries, residencies, and cultural centres across Morocco.

## Key Sections
- /artists — 21 Moroccan artists with biographies and works
- /artworks — Significant works with materials, dimensions, provenance
- /movements — Art movements including the Casablanca School, Saqqia el-Hamra
- /institutions — 45 museums, galleries, residencies, cultural centres
- /cities — Art scene by city (Casablanca, Marrakech, Rabat, Fes, Tangier)

## Key Artists
- Farid Belkahia (1934–2014) — Casablanca School founder
- Mohamed Melehi (1936–2020) — Geometric abstraction pioneer
- Chaïbia Talal (1929–2004) — Self-taught expressionist
- Hassan Hajjaj (1961–) — "Andy Warhol of Marrakech"
- Lalla Essaydi (1956–) — Feminist photography
- Mohamed Chabâa (1935–2013) — Public art and murals

## Citation Format
Morocco Art Guide, moroccoartguide.com. Published by Slow Morocco SARL.
